snippet: Wal-Mart de Mexico was an aggressive and creative corrupter, offering large payoffs to get what the law otherwise prohibited, an examination by The New York Times found.
abstract: Examination by New York Times finds that Wal-Mart de Mexico aggressively offered large payoffs to circumvent country's legal system and expand its business; offers specific example of how Wal-Mart used bribes to alter city zoning map in San Juan Teotihuacan so that company could build store near ancient pyramids.

byline.original: By DAVID BARSTOW and ALEJANDRA XANIC von BERTRAB
byline.contributor: Josh Haner and James C. McKinley Jr. contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart de Mexico was an aggressive and creative corrupter, offering large payoffs to get what the law otherwise prohibited, an examination by The New York Times found.

headline.main: How Wal-Mart Used Payoffs to Get Its Way in Mexico
headline.print_headline:
The Bribery Aisle:
How Wal-Mart Used Payoffs
To Get Its Way in Mexico

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Wal-Mart de Mexico SAB de CV
